poem:
Title: "An American Wake-Up Call"

Under the long days of a clown
and his capering crew,
corruption sung its melody and danced.
Now a judge, weeping in the ink of laws,
peels back the veil.
1,700 sins laid bare on silicon,
echoing through courtrooms like empty shot glasses;
our salvation, maybe,
or maybe just a hangover.
Either way, the dawn inches closer.
